questions.question: The Red Cross ……………………. food and shelter for disaster victims.
questions.description: Use the simple present to talk about facts. When the subject is a singular noun, the verb takes the marker -s in the simple present tense.

questions.question: Her constant nagging ……………………… him.
questions.description: To simply say that something happened, we use the simple past.

questions.question: The islanders were warned that a storm …………………….. coming.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the past tense, the verb in the subordinate clause too will be in the past tense.

questions.question: Revisions ……………………….. to bring the text up to date.
Criminals ……………………….. to return to the scene of crime.
questions.description: This is the passive version of the simple present tense. The simple present is used to talk about facts.

questions.question: I …………………….. South America in my youth.
questions.description: The simple past is used when we say when something happened.

questions.question: Many pilgrims ………………………. his same path to the shrine.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to give news.

questions.question: He ............................ the rest of his life in the wheelchair.
questions.description: The simple past is the most common tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: I ................................ to go.
questions.description: Would like is common in polite requests.
